Function Documentation

void mos_cond_broadcast (  mos_cond_t *  cond  ) 
 

Signal all threads waiting on a condition variable.

The calling thread should lock the mutex that the waiting threads used to call mos_cond_wait(). Unlike semaphores, signals are lost when no threads waiting.

Parameters:
cond Condition variable to signal

void mos_cond_init (  mos_cond_t *  cond  ) 
 

Init a condition variable data structure.

Must init before use.

Parameters:
cond Condition variable to init

void mos_cond_signal (  mos_cond_t *  cond  ) 
 

Signal exactly one thread waiting on a condition variable.

The calling thread should lock the mutex that the waiting thread used to call mos_cond_wait(). Unlike semaphores, signals are lost when no threads waiting.

Parameters:
cond Condition variable to signal

void mos_cond_wait (  mos_cond_t *  cond,
mos_mutex_t *  mt
) 
 

Wait on a condition variable.

Atomically releases the mutex and waits on the condition variable. On return the mutex is locked again. The caller should use the same mutex that the threads that call mos_cond_broadcast() or mos_cond_signal() use for this condition variable.

Parameters:
cond Condition variable to wait on
mt Mutex to unlock. Locked on return.
